concept.title: Creating Related Topics Links
concept.shortdesc: Related topics links are cross-references to other topics within your online content.

conbody.p:
related topics links creating
Related topic links take users to other topics that content creators believe will provide users with useful information about the topic they are currently viewing. ePublisher can display related topics links as text in the generated output as well as in a related topics section below the content. In the sample ePublisher Express Trial stationery, the Stationery Designer configured the related topics links to display in the text and a related topics section at the bottom of the content.

You create related topics links by applying a RelatedTopic paragraph format to a list of cross-references you want to display as related topics for a topic in your source documents. When you generated output, the list of cross-references will automatically display as related topic links with the style information in the stationery.
